His research focuses on mobile sensing, ubiquitous computing, human-computer interaction, and cyber-physical systems security. Florida State University, 2022 MS, Transportation and Highway Eng Beijing Jiaotang University, 2014 BS, Information Science/Studies Beijing Jiaotang University, 2010 Courses Taught Most Recent Academic Year CYBR 2600 Networking & Cyber Security Teaching Interests My teaching interests are deeply rooted in my research on ubiquitous computing and intelligent sensing. I am enthusiastic about offering advanced courses in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Mobile Computing, Internet of Things (IoT), and Cyber-Physical Systems, where students can gain hands-on experience with modern smart technologies. Furthermore, I am committed to teaching foundational courses in Computer Networks and Cyber Security, ensuring students build a robust understanding of the infrastructure that powers and protects these systems.
